intro: Hieracium dolabratum, commonly known as the sandhill hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or gravelly habitats, often in disturbed areas such as roadsides and meadows. Its yellow-orange flower heads consist of numerous tiny florets arranged in a radiate pattern. Hieracium dolabratum is an herbaceous perennial that produces a basal rosette of leaves and has hairy stems.
